items.name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Any Indian citizen wanting to start or expand a non-farm income-generating activity  (individuals, proprietary firms, partnership firms, etc.)
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme: Seeks to promote entrepreneurship and financial inclusion among small business owners and individuals who may not have access to traditional banking services.


Benefits of the Scheme: Offers collateral-free loans up to ₹20 lakh to micro and small enterprises for income-generating activities in manufacturing, trading, and services.


Who can Apply: Any Indian citizen wanting to start or expand a non-farm income-generating activity (individuals, proprietary firms, partnership firms, etc.)

items.name: Kisan Credit Card
items.beneficiaries: All farmers, including individual farmers, joint borrowers, tenant farmers, and  sharecroppers.
items.description:
Aim: Provide farmers with timely and adequate credit to meet their short-term and long-term agricultural needs.


Benefits: Delivers short-term credit support for agricultural and allied activities, such as animal husbandry and fisheries.


Who can Apply: All farmers, including individual farmers, joint borrowers, tenant farmers, and sharecroppers.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri SVANidhi
items.beneficiaries: Street vendors engaged in vending on or before March 24, 2020.
items.description:
Aim: Empowers street vendors with working capital loans and promotes digital transactions.


Benefits: Collateral-free working capital loans up to ₹10,000, a low-interest rate of 7%, and incentives for digital transactions. The scheme also promotes financial inclusion and self-reliance among street vendors.


Who can apply: Street vendors engaged in vending on or before March 24, 2020.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Vishwakarma
items.beneficiaries: Traditional artisans and craftspeople practising 18 specified trades.
items.description:
Aim: To support traditional artisans with toolkit incentives, skill development, and collateral-free credit.


Benefits: Offers basic skill training (5-7 days) with a stipend of ₹500 per day, a Toolkit incentive of ₹15,000, and a collateral-free loan up to ₹2 lakh at a concessional interest rate.


Who can apply: Traditional artisans and craftspeople practising 18 specified trades.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Vidyalakshmi
items.beneficiaries: Indian students seeking financial assistance for higher education.
items.description:
Aim: A unified platform for students to apply for education loans from multiple banks.


Benefits: Beneficiaries generally receive up to ₹7.5 lakh (in India) and ₹20 lakh (abroad), as per bank norms. This program is linked with the Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme.


Who can apply: Indian students seeking financial assistance for higher education.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi
items.beneficiaries: All landholding farmers with cultivable land.
items.description:
Aim: Provides direct financial support to landholding farmer families in India.


Benefits: Deliver financial assistance of ₹6,000/year in three equal instalments to farmers.


Who can apply: All landholding farmers with cultivable land.

The following categories of beneficiaries of higher economic status shall not be eligible for benefits under the scheme:

1. All Institutional landholders.

2. Farmer families in which one or more of their members belong to the following categories

3. Former and present holders of constitutional posts

4. Former and present Ministers/ State Ministers and former/present Members of LokSabha/ RajyaSabha/ State Legislative Assemblies/ State Legislative Councils, former and present Mayors of Municipal Corporations, former and present Chairpersons of District Panchayats.

5. All serving or retired officers and employees of Central/ State Government Ministries /Offices/Departments and their field units, Central or State PSEs, and Attached offices /Autonomous Institutions under Government, as well as regular employees of the Local Bodies (Excluding Multi Tasking Staff /Class IV/Group D employees)

6. All superannuated/retired pensioners whose monthly pension is ₹10,000/- or more (Excluding Multi Tasking Staff / Class IV/Group D employees) of the above category

7. All Persons who paid Income Tax in the last assessment year

8. Professionals, such as doctors, Engineers, Lawyers, Chartered Accountants, and Architects, are registered with Professional bodies and carry out their profession by undertaking practices.

items.name: Sukanya Samruddhi Yojana (SSY)
items.beneficiaries: Girl child up to age 10; one account per child (maximum two accounts for two  daughters).
items.description:
Aim: Long-term savings scheme for girl child with tax benefits under Section 80C.


Benefits: Investment advantages include high return interest rates, tax benefits, and flexible deposit options.


Who can Apply: Girl child up to age 10; one account per child (maximum two accounts for two daughters).

items.name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Economically weaker sections as identified by the Socio-Economic and Caste Census (SECC),  2011 data.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide health insurance to economically weaker sections of society.


B. Benefits Provided: Health insurance coverage of ₹5 lakh per family per year for hospitalisation.


C. Eligibility: Economically weaker sections as identified by the Socio-Economic and Caste Census (SECC), 2011 data.


1. Out of the total seven deprivation criteria for rural areas, PM-JAY covered all such families who fall into at least one of the following six deprivation criteria (D1 to D5 and D7) and automatic inclusion(Destitute/ living on alms, manual scavenger households, primitive tribal group, legally released bonded labour) criteria:

a. D1- Only one room with kucha walls and kucha roof

b. D2- No adult member between ages 16 to 59

c. D3- Households with no adult male member between ages 16 to 59

d. D4- Disabled member and no able-bodied adult member

e. D5- SC/ST households

f. D7- Landless households deriving a major part of their income from manual casual labour


2. For urban areas, the following 11 occupational categories of workers are eligible for the scheme:

a. Ragpicker

b. Beggar

c. Domestic worker

d. Street vendor/ Cobbler/hawker / other service provider working on streets

e. Construction worker/ Plumber/ Mason/ Labour/ Painter/ Welder/ Security guard/ Coolie and other head-load worker

f. Sweeper/ Sanitation worker/ Mali

g. Home-based worker/ Artisan/ Handicrafts worker/ Tailor

h. Transport worker/ Driver/ Conductor/ Helper to drivers and conductors/ Cart puller/ Rickshaw puller

i. Shop worker/ Assistant/ Peon in small establishment/ Helper/Delivery assistant / Attendant/ Waiter

j. Electrician/ Mechanic/ Assembler/ Repair worker

k. Washer-man/ Chowkidar


3. Exclusions

a. Those who own a two, three, or four-wheeler or a motorized fishing boat.

b. Those who own mechanized farming equipment.

c. Those who have Kisan cards with a credit limit of ₹50,000.

d. Those employed by the government

e. Those who work in government-managed non-agricultural enterprises.

f. Those earning a monthly income above ₹10,000.

g. Those owning refrigerators and landlines.

h. Those with decent, solidly built houses.

i. Those owning 5 acres or more of agricultural land.

items.name: Atal Pension Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Citizens between the ages of 18 and 40 who have a bank account.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide a fixed monthly pension to subscribers after they reach the age of 60.


Benefits Provided:

1. A fixed monthly pension ranging from ₹1,000 to ₹5,000 after the age of 60.

2. The government provides a co-contribution for eligible subscribers.


Eligibility:

1. Citizens between the ages of 18 and 40 who have a bank account.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Shramyogi Maandhan
items.beneficiaries: Unorganised workers, such as domestic help and vendors.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide a monthly pension to unorganised workers after they reach the age of 60.


Benefits Provided:

1. A monthly pension of ₹3,000 after attaining the age of 60.

2. The government makes a matching contribution equal to the subscriber's monthly contribution.


Eligibility:

1. Unorganised workers, such as domestic help and vendors.

2. Applicants aged 18-40 with a monthly income of less than ₹15,000.

3. Exclusion Criteria: Should not be covered under the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF), Employees’ State Insurance Corporation (ESIC), or National Pension Scheme (NPS). Should not be an income taxpayer. Should not be receiving benefits from any other government pension scheme.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Provides a ₹2 lakh life insurance cover for death due to any reason.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide life insurance coverage.


Benefits Provided:

1. Provides a ₹2 lakh life insurance cover for death due to any reason.

2. The payout of ₹2 lakh is given to the nominee.

3. Annual premium is ₹436.


Eligibility:

1. Individuals aged 18–50 who have a bank account.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Insurance cover of ₹2 lakh for accidental death and disability.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide accidental death and disability insurance coverage.


Benefits Provided:

1. Insurance cover of ₹2 lakh for accidental death and disability.

2. The annual premium is ₹20.

3. The payout is given to the nominee (in case of death) or the policyholder (in case of disability).


Eligibility:

1. Individuals aged 18–70 with a bank account.

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Employment Generation Programme
items.beneficiaries: Any individual above 18 years of age who has passed at least the 8th standard.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide a margin money subsidy for setting up new micro-enterprises.


Benefits Provided:

1. A subsidy of 15–35% of the project cost, depending on the applicant's category and location.

2. The maximum loan amount is up to ₹25 lakh for the manufacturing sector and ₹10 lakh for the service sector.


Eligibility:

1. Any individual above 18 years of age who has passed at least the 8th standard.

2. The scheme is only for new units.

3. Only one person from one family is eligible for obtaining financial assistance for setting up of projects under PMEGP. The 'family’ includes self and spouse.

items.name: Credit Guarantee Fund Trust For MSME
items.beneficiaries: Provides a credit guarantee to financial institutions for giving collateral-free loans to Micro and Small  Enterprises (MSEs)
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. To provide a credit guarantee to financial institutions for giving collateral-free loans to Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs).


Benefits Provided:

1. Provides a guarantee cover for loans up to ₹5 crore.

2. The guarantee cover ranges up to 80% of the loan amount.


Eligibility:


1. Existing as well as new MSEs engaged in manufacturing, trading or services, excluding agriculture, self-help groups, etc.

2. The Member Lending Institutions (MLIs) must assess and adjudge the business as viable and profitable, with a good track record.

3. The borrower must not be a defaulter with any bank or financial institution.

4. The criteria for Micro & Small Enterprises are separately mentioned in the MSMED Act, 2006. The eligibility is based on the investment made in equipment, plant and machinery as well as turnover of the entity

items.name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana
items.beneficiaries: Provides financial aid in the form of subsidies for various fisheries-related activities like pond  construction and hatcheries.
items.description:
Aim of the Scheme:

1. This scheme was launched to develop India's fisheries sector by providing financial support for f ishermen's safety kits, boat upgrades, rearing ponds, and aquaculture.


Benefits Provided:

1. Provides financial aid in the form of subsidies for various fisheries-related activities like pond construction and hatcheries.

2. The subsidy provided is 40% for the General category and 60% for SC/ST/Women beneficiaries.


Eligibility:

1. Fish farmers, fishers, Fish Workers and Fish Vendors, Fisheries Development Corporations, Fish Farmers Producer Organizations/companies, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and cooperatives involved in f isheries as well as Entrepreneurs and Private Firms.
